file_content.text: Why won't you accept that our victory is inevitable? Destroying my servant won't end this.
How many to end, traitor? Twenty? Hundred? Send them!
In that case, killing you might be more productive.
Maybe not, but we can wreck your day trying.
Traitors deserve a slower end anyway.
The First Son of the Emperor will lead us to glory. Your death is the first step on that path.
At least give me the courtesy of knowing my enemy's name.
Who is the First Son? Tell me!
Die in ignorance.
I don't think so.
I've heard enough. [Attack]
It has been agony, restraining myself from killing you.
And here's our guest of honor. Kyrus! If the Jedi takes one step toward Their Majesties, cut their throats.
It will be done, my master.
We're no threat to you! Please, at least release my wife!
I know you can exploit any advantage, Jedi. So the soldiers had to die. The civilians too. I do, after all, take pride in being thorough.
So much darkness, and I never felt anything from you except fear.
You hid your true nature well.
Hmm. Is that curiosity, or envy?
I'm the one you want. Call Kyrus off, and we'll talk.
Don't hurt the royal family.
What could you possibly offer, compared to what I already have?
I saved you from the Fortitude, and you stab me in the back.
You once begged to be rescued.
Yes, Arrax was overenthusiastic... but his purge of the Fortitude was useful.
I'm no mere infiltrator. I am Augin Blaesus, and I am a Child of the Emperor.
I was brought before the Emperor as an infant and imprinted with his power, his consciousness. I shared the greatest mind in the galaxy.
With the First Son concealing my presence, I joined hundreds of my brothers and sisters scattered throughout the Republic. To watch, and wait.
Who is this First Son you speak of?
The First Son?
Supreme among those to receive this honor. I can't even comprehend the power he wields.
One man couldn't hide hundreds of infiltrators from an entire galaxy of Jedi.
"Concealing you"? Impossible.
A single Jedi healer severed Terrak Morrhage from his army, as I recall.
You may believe you're the Emperor's chosen, but all Sith die the same way.
You're nothing special.
You think so? Sith fight to master the powers we Children use as infants.
This is immaterial. An Imperial fleet is coming. You will all be destroyed. And without the Rift Alliance, the Republic is finished.
But the Empire is merciful, Your Highness. Your planet could be spared the coming destruction.
How? Tell me!
Order your bodyguards to kill the Jedi.
All resistance to evil begins with saying "no."
Don't submit to him.
Even if you agree, he'll betray you, and the Empire will destroy your world.
You can't trust this man.
If your men attack me, they'll be cut down. Blaesus can't escape justice.
Do it, and I'll defend myself.
You're lecturing us? After you recruited Captain Valon--that monster?
But threatening someone's family, like you did on Balmorra? That makes you as bad as this Empire!
We can't risk our people for this Jedi. If killing her will save them, we agree.
We can't risk our people for this Jedi. If his death will save them, we agree.
You are wise. Kyrus? I promised you the Jedi's heart. Now's your chance to claim it.
Senator Grell told us about your courage. I will not raise my hand against you.
Your Empire's friendship is worthless to us.
You'll regret being so stubborn when your planet is burning. Kyrus, show them how a Jedi dies.
